reviewText:
Summary:
A poor port of a game that's missing one of the basic mechanics you need in a shoot em up: fun. While having an interesting premise and some cool character designs all around, the game fails to deliver as levels are way too easy at times and literally lack any sort of oompf to them whatsoever. The game's graphics could use improvement overall, but the bigger problem comes when character designs clash against the background in terms of being able to see enemies and or bullets against it. Honestly, I can go on here about what the game did wrong, and what the game needs, but in the end: it isn't fun, and that's a major problem for a game that's attempting to get your attention, in particular in this genre. It lacks the energy and the execution needed to really stand out.

Gameplay and Video First Impressions:  http://youtu.be/KnxvsW6Ky10

Lists:
+:
Some good character designs, in particular with boss monsters, and using the material of ice cream/veggies well.
Cute premise and could work well with kids. Audio of characters are fine and reasonably well done. Was unexpected
Different characters play differently with a reasonable change up in what they do.-:
Lacks a fun factor. Boring, repetitive, and down right just meh.
The game's inconsistencies within its world and gameplay will show up right away, whether it be attempting to pick up a powerup only to find you have to shoot it first, or what you are fighting. A very uneven experience.
Minimal effort to port. Coop players score elements show up here, controls for controller don't bind themselves naturally to industry standards, and frankly transitions to other parts of the game are down right awkward.
The environment clashes with gameplay at times which is a huge problem. Don't put the same shades of white in the background and on enemies that you are expecting people to see without any issue.
Specials lack oompf in several cases, and feel like a waste. In one or two instances, I died when an uncontrollable special happened (which seems like a prime reason not to use it.).
1 Achievement that literally was given when starting the game. If you're not going to use them, don't bother with them, you don't have to have them on Steam.
Weird inconsistency in player models from character to character without anything to counterbalance it.
Crackers in bikinis are just weird. I may be a horrible person for thinking this, but it stand out against the kiddish nature of everything else.

reviewText: Could be a nice retro sidescroller & shoot'em'up, but the console port is simply too poor.\nThere must be a function in Unity that you drop a finished console game into a container and make immediately a Steam title of it. Unfortunately there are some resolution issues on PC. It flips everytime into fullscreen here, even if windowed mode is bewished. The controls are totally unknown in the first moment (m for menu? seriously?) . So is the button how to exit the game. The graphics and music are nice but you can hardly distinguish enemy bullets from power pickups. So I played the first level for the achievement. Wish there was more to discover.

reviewText: 8bit retro shooter, 'cute' story but controller support is sketchy with a common Logitech F310, so I had to use keyboard.  Still 10 minutes to get the one achievement gained after clearing the first level.\n\nCheap bundle game, and thats about it.  4/10 in a bundle for about 35c, but you will be unhappy at $2.99.

reviewText: So unspeakably bad, the only jolly thing is that by default you can't actually choose any menu options, giving you a good reason to quit immediately.\n\n(Unfortunately I found the button that lets you reach the place where you can rebind the controls, and then got to enjoy them in all their bizarre delay. The game even wanted me to kill some super-cute animals. Ban it, I say.)

reviewText:
Absolute trash. Not even worth 50p.
Can`t recognise two standard Xbox controllers. With one plugged in you still have to use the keyboard to get back to the menu. On the game over screen I don`t even know what key I pressed to get back to the menu as ESC doesn`t do anything and neither does the Start button on the controller.
Once on the menu screen I couldn`t even exit the game. Had to CTRL-ALT-DEL and End Task. If there is a way to exit then it`s not very obvious.
Only bought this because the kids wanted it after seeing the trailer. Never even got to play the game properly as the controller and menu bugs put me off before we even started.
Just wanted a simple two player shooter for my boys to play together using controllers but it seems that`s too much to ask on Ice Cream Surfer.

Didn`t expect much for a couple of quid, but expected a slightly more polished menu and controller system.
Yet another piece of software released before being finished.
I look forward to the first update, maybe I can rate the gameplay then.

reviewText:
oh hell dogshit no is there anything worse than having to hit the button over and over again everytime i want to shoot?! there is no excuse not to be able to hold down the button to shoot in a shooter. i'm pretty stupid though, so i kept playing anyway.

i picked some sasquatch dude floating on a sandwich or something.  sasquatch's ♥♥♥♥ projectiles he vomits out don't even make it across the screen before dissipating, so i have to get right in front of the enemies to hit them. thats really fun. about 30 seconds in, i die for no apparent reason at all.

i got to some big walrus guy, and oh hell no, for the first time in my life, hearts are not something good that my character needs, but instead they are bad projectiles that kill you. thats ok though because continue screen pops right up so i can keep going. oh, whats that now? there is not a single button on the controller that actually works to make the game continue? thats great.

still, i said ♥♥♥♥ it, and decided to try one more character, except now i was stuck in the game over screen and couldnt find a button anywhere on the controller or keyboard to actually get me out of it.

in closing, let us pray.

dear jesus, i pray that you realize you sent this game to earth for the mortals to play, when i am sure you actually meant to send it down to hell as a punishment for the sinners. may you find it in your infinite wisdom to remove it from my steam library and erase it from my memory now and forevermore.

god bless amen

reviewText: As a fan of scrolling shooters and cute-em-ups" in particular you have no idea how much it pains me to slap a negative rating onto this one: in my opinion there are few things the modern
date: self-serious gaming landscape could use more than a straightforward
hoursPlayed: mustachioed piece of broccoli and a bunch of dessert-themed superheroes out to stop his nefarious veggie-centric schemes. Unfortunately
voteText: while the developers behind Ice Cream Surfer appear to have had their hearts in the right place
helpfulPercent: their execution simply does not do justice to Twinbee
votesTotal: and the other more illustrious goofball shooters to come before it.\n\nAfter picking one of five characters to blast off with (be advised that some are much less effective than others)
votesFunny: you traverse a handful of side-scrolling worlds
commentsCount: shooting down various cute and/or ridiculous baddies and collecting the shiny gems
column18: and bonus letters they leave behind
column19: expending a bomb when you need a trump card. This
column22: since your player sprites (and hitboxes) are so large that maneuvering through gaps is very difficult
column23: and enemy shots are very small and difficult to see. This is especially a shame since the candy-colored visuals are not bad to look at
column24: and it would be nice to have the opportunity to admire the scenery a bit without worrying that a pinprick-sized bullet will steal a life away from you in the meantime. Even discounting that
column26: which means you have to mash the shot key to keep a steady stream of attacks coming; this would be merely irritating if the fire rate was decent (or if a charge shot was available)
column27: but no matter how quickly you tap there's a strict limit to how potent your offense can get
column28: especially when at your default pea-shooter power level...and the fact that you lose everything when you die means that you'll be dealing with that frequently.\n\nOut on the periphery there are numerous additional unfixed issues that are unlikely to ever be addressed: the screen options don't work
column30: the post-stage roundup screen scrolls by too fast to read
column31: and so forth. I hate to do it
column33: even if you're hungering for a throwback to the good old days when you'd beat up a bunch of ninjas to earn a burger invite from Ronald Reagan and nobody batted an eye
column34: don't let this game lure you in: your fond memories of those times will only end up melting away into an unsightly puddle
column35: like a forgotten bowl of vanilla fudge swirl on a summer evening."

reviewText:
First impression: cheesy retro shooter that suffers from control support

Plays the way the screenshots suggest, but the gamepad support seems partial at best: I couldn't find out how to select items from the menus. While the game is set up to allow two players doing local co-op, we couldn't get that to work properly using keyboard controls. The actual stages can be played using keyboard or an Xbox controller.

If local co-op worked, I would recommend it for some nice cheap 2-player fun. As it is, I don't.

reviewText:
4min of this game (shows all 5 characters. check my channel for a ful lrun)
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Id8RdOtP6Fw

-NOTE- you need to hit H on the keyboard to continue or confirm some options, also there is no auto fire, or exit game" option.

A simple shmup with cute graphics and (overly) easy gameplay based on ice cream treats.
You play as 1 of 5 characters fighting various vegetables cause diabetes i guess.
Each has their own unique shot and special.
As you kill enemies they will drop gems that when grabbed will fill a power bar.
When the power bar is filled your attack will get stronger and it will sometimes add a spread to it.
Other items will drop from enemies like popsicle (fills your power bar)
date: color changing popsicles (makes you invincible and damage anything you touch)
recommended: keys (a cupcake will follow you shooting when you do & will let you take 1 hit)
hoursPlayed: & letters spelling "ice cream" (i have not gotten all the letter on a board yet)"

reviewText:
Funny story, really good design for his genere.
The main problems are the control scheme and the control answer. at first you MUST reset the keyborad because the default keys are scattered, then in the game the controls are really imprecise and laggy, not the best for a shooter game.
Even with a joypad it's quite the same.
It's really frustrating to play.
Aside from game looking ridicilous (about story...no comment), but this game is os bad port that this is an insult for every player.

I played it once for about five minutes and didn't like it a bit, but it somehow gave me the 'completed game' achievement and became my first perfect game on Steam. I had to go through each and every one of my 200+ games' achievements lists to find that out\n\nEasy 100% I guess, but man is it boring. Sorry devs, but you struck out hard on this one.
